data.name: RichTextBox1.Text
data.value:
General Flow: 1) Administration, Tournament Setup Enter Tournament Name Setup Division Descriptions Setup Bout Win Types (Win Points functionality not yet implemented) 2) Setup Participants Verify Participant has the appropriate Division assigned Click, then Right-Click on participant to Display the record for Edit or Delete This is a good time to print the Participant List incase of computer failure. It can be used to do the bracketing manually if needed. 3) Assign Participants to Classes Add Classes and thier discriptions as needed Ctrl-Click or Shift-Click to highlight multiply participants then click on a class and click the "->" button to finish the assignment "X" will set the participant back to "UnAssigned" 4) Populate Brackets for a Division. Once this is done do not change the division or class of that divisions participants. If this is re-run any manual changes as far as paring or bracket positioning will be overwritten 5) Reports Print Bout Sheets, Brackets and Participant List. 6) Option, Put Results in Brackets Put Results in Brackets by double-click in the bout result boxs and reprint bracket for display Manual change of parings within this bracket can be done by double clicking on the bracket participant name box. When manually changing participants within the bracket all rounds must be adjusted manually.
Other Info. By default the database location is in your My Documents folder and the filename is "RRWT.db" If you click the drop down box for the filename you can select RRWTDemo.db. This is a pre-populated database with sample data. After using the Demo database for awhile you may want to check the box "Refresh Demo Data", this will reset the demo data to its initial state.
RRWT can also send the bracket report to a web page as a PDF for the crowd view on thier tablets or cell phones. This routine is located under the Administration tab of RRWT. If you have been entering the results you can do the upload as often as you want so the parents can follow along. Currently the site is https://rickreinicke.wixsite.com/wwrt.
Installation: Take all the defaults when installing. After installing and during the initial startup of the program it will ask to install one more piece of software, just take all the defaults again. If you ever need to re-install you must first uninstall RRWTApp from the Add Remove Programs section of your Windows Control Panel. Leave any feedback on Software tab of the web site (https://rickreinicke.wixsite.com/wwrt)
Hope you Enjoy.
